text: hi it's angel today's tip Tuesday and
then this week's helping kitchen tip I'm
going to show you how to cut cherry
tomatoes and grapes quickly and all at
once now you might be wondering when
would I ever need to use this tip but if
you're like me and you signed yourself
up for a potluck this weekend where you
need to bring a fruit salad and a
cucumber and cherry tomato salad this is
definitely a super helpful time-saving
kitchen shortcut so with that let's get
started for this kitchen shortcut we
will need two small lids or plates of
the same size and right now I'm just
using some Pyrex lids that I have we'll
put one lid down on the cutting board
then fill that up with our cherry
tomatoes once you have all your trade
Tomatoes laid out take your second lid
put it right on top hold firmly with one
hand and with your other hand take the
knife and run it in between the gap
slicing the cherry tomatoes in half
now we have all our cherry tomatoes cut
up they're perfect and ready to eat the
only thing to keep in mind is when
slicing in between these lids you want
to make sure that your knife is even and
it goes in a straight line so that way
your cherry tomatoes are cut perfectly
in half now this tip also works for
grapes as well or any other small round
fruits and vegetables so I hope you guys
enjoyed this week's kitchen tip join me
next week for another tip Tuesday I'll
see you guys next time bye
